Reviews.Title: “Basement room!”
Reviews.Author: cazbar2
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Got there at 11.30 am and was told room ready.In the basement and was not the best place to be.Very basic and dark. Clean though and warm if you switched the radiators on. Boiling hot water. Should have requested another room. Especially when we checked out and was asked "Oh so you were ok in that room? Most people dont like it!"Imagine in the summer the basement rooms would be noisy and hot. 50 euro per person deposit was unexpected and by the time we had discussed between ourselves that we would leave a credit card number the receptionist had filled out a form for cash which she didnt want to change!Breakfast hard boiled egg (hot though) warmed roll and a plate of cheese and meats. Some sliced bread, orange juice and tea or coffee. 2 types of cereal.If I had not got this "free" with avios points I would have been upset!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel,”
Reviews.Author: Katarzyna Vikto... F Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good experience I have had. The hotel is very quiet and the staff has been very friendly and helpful. The conditions are good, however I would suggest to place a kettle in each room to allow the customers to make their own herbal, relaxing tea to unwind after an excessive walking. Also, the location is perfect especially for someone who comes from such a noisy place like London. The hotel is in a very lovely residential area and at the same time very close (walking distance) to the centre and tourists' attractions, eg dimonds museum. .......... .. .... ... .. .. ...... .............. ............ .......... ............. .............. .................. ............. ................ ..... ...... .... ........... ............ ... ...... ............ ............... ............ ........... .............. .................. .............. .................... .............. ............................. ............. ................ ............. .............. ... ... ....... .......

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gemini31_rahul
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam in the month of march and stayed in hotel sander for 2 nights. It is the usually recommended hotel by Indian travel agents. However i found the hotel to be very basic with extremely small rooms, TV not working, the most basic breakfast spread i found in my stay across Europe. The staff is courteous and willing to guide tourists. It is a little light on your pocket and hence may make sense. Located near a tram station and travel within Amsterdam city is very convenient. Not recommended for those looking for a relatively lavish stay.

Reviews.Title: “Little value”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeCurious
Reviews.Content: I had booked a three-star hotel room and got a shabby and! tiny room worthy of a maximum of one star. The hotel is not too far away from the center of Amsterdam and is staffed by attentive personnel, which are probably the two good things I can say about this place. The room provided by the attentive staff was on the backside; the carpet had stains in it. The room was barely big enough for the bed and in-room! sink; the bathroom sported a shower and a toilet bowl, which must have been put in by an an enthusiastic, but nonetheless amateur plumber. It simply did not look very professional. The hotel does not provide parking, even though outside the hotel there are two signs, boasting that the hotel is recommended by auto clubs in Switzerland and Germany. Parking around the hotel costs about â‚¬4 per hour. The staff pointed out that parking can be had at the reasonable price of â‚¬8 per 24 hours at the Olympic Stadium about 2km off. If all that was not enough, I was really taken aback by the fact that credit-card payments cost extra! The hotel slaps another 4% on top if you have the nerve to pay by credit card! I could have survived one night with a room which had its best days twenty years ago and parking that was a brisk twenty-minute walk away, but the extra payment for the credit card was too much.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service; untidy, shabby hovel”
Reviews.Author: krebs030
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a clean one, and breakfast is just a fake 'buffet': only a small dish with very tiny slices of cheese(1), salami(1) and ham(1) per person! The bed is 30cms from the walls... The carpet (even the one which covers the elevator walls...) is very old and untidy. You have to give more 4% of your bill if you pay it by credit card, plus residence taxes (more 22Euros) not included in the reservation, even if already paid. You certainly get a better deal at the centre for the same price or lower!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, just off tram route, clean, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: vincefowler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of June 2011. It is located in a quiet, residential area of the city, just round the corner from the No 16 tram stop which runs through the city centre to the central station. Vondel park is within 400 metres and there is a pizzeria and two cafe/restaurants (all popular with the locals) within 300 metres. Our room on the third floor was clean and comfortable and a good breakfast was provided, comprising juices, cereals, boiled egg, ham, cheese and preserves. The price was not out of the way, considering Amsterdam prices in general.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline 3 star city center bid will get you THIS! Go outside the center for a better deal and easy tram access!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanGirl27
Reviews.Content: In the states, a 3 star bid in almost any city gets you a decent, clean (hamton inn, etc) hotel. Not in AMS, so you have to get a b&b or bid for 4-5 star place. We had a basement room, which was so gross... mirror falling off wall, bad carpet, TINY bathroom, tile broken, mold, etc. I felt gross in there. PROS: -near museaums ("I amsterdam" sigh) and tram. -safe neighborhood, beautiful trees, apartments, etc. great ambiance. CONS: -20 minute walk to anything besides museums -horrible service (made us check out at 11 even though priceline said 12) -7 EURO "departure hotel tax" on top of the priceline payment -bad internet -YOU CAN HEAR EVERY WOrD OF YOUR NEIGHBORS, so if they come in at 2 am, you hear it.... If you expand your bit to "city center south" you will be in another, slightly farther residential area and just 5-10 min away from the city. After we left the hell hole that was the Sander, we got a 5 star for $175 just a 5 minute tram ride away from Sander and could have gotten 3-4 star for much cheaper. Pay for the unlimited tram card (an above ground train for easy access to eveything) for 7Euro/day and you can go all over the city SO easily. BOTTOM LINE- THIS HOTEL SUX!!!!!!!! I'm a flight attendant and have stayed at some pretty bad places, but this one was one of the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: Jacki66
Reviews.Content: Unpleasant staff who placed us in a dingy basement room on Day 1 then moved us (a married couple) to two single rooms on separate floors Day 2 - the single rooms were tiny, dingy, scruffy with no tea/coffee facilities, no iron, no basic hairdryer, the tiny tele hardly worked, had to practically crawl up the steep stairs to our rooms, even the room door didn't open or lock properly ! Our Story - The Guesthouse we'd first booked into had lost our reservation upon arrival in Amsterdam so the guesthouse owner found us our alternative, The Hotel Sander, during a busy Easter weekend, the Hotel Sander gloated about "Quadrupling" their room rates because (a) it was Easter, (b) we were desperate for a room or we'd be flying home again ! yes I'm aware many hotels enjoy doing this to their guests but I've never seen a hotel look so pleased about it right to your face which destroyed my otherwise high opinion of the Dutch and would have totally ruined a romantic weekend except we are better than that and still managed to have a good time away from our hotel experience(s). I would not return to the Hotel Sander if they offered me a free weekend - I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy ... be afraid be very afraid !!! ps. 460 Euros was charged for 2 nights in below average rooms - everything about this hotel is completely shameful !

Reviews.Title: “Down in the dungeon”
Reviews.Author: moggiuk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel well in advance, we were horrified at our room which was down in the basement underneath the bar and reception, we had no sleep, and it was dark and dingy. the staff were helpfull and friendly, apart for the lady who checked us in, she was miserable and not at all friendly, overall it was ok for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Must be going downhill quickly since Summer 2009!”
Reviews.Author: Charles G
Reviews.Content: Judging from recent reviews, the place is going downhill fast! My review is based on my July 2009 stay. And unless you have the $ to stay at an American chain hotel, come to AMS prepared that room/amenity standards are quite different than in the U.S. Pros: Tree-lined street in mainly residential neighborhood, close to Museum Square, Concertgebouw, public tram to take you everywhere, a public express bus to Schipol Airport (a lot faster than taking the train), good breakfast, close to excellent Albert Heijn food store, free wireless in lobby/restaurant area. Cons: perfunctory staff (then again I generally found that in any AMS service personnel over the age of 30); no air conditioning; room comfort varies (my 1st room was decent-sized, a double bed in the basement below the dining area with a pleasant view of backyard, quiet and COOL. But one night I stayed in the TINY top floor front room--so hot I couldn't sleep and you could hear traffic noice from a nearby busy street). The stairs are EXTREMELY narrow and no one told me there was an elevator! GEEZ! I did my homework before going to AMS. But I must believe now there's a better place for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: giu12
Reviews.Content: I would like to write about my stay in the Sander Hotel in Amsterdam. You should avoid this hotel as much as you can. That was my second time in Sanderâ€™s but the owner must be changed. My first visit was four years ago and the warm and kind reception that I found there last time has completely gone as well as the cleanliness of the rooms. The breakfast was served without any politeness the waitresses of the coffee suggested that we should take breakfast in two separated tables because she was not in the mood to clean up a table which fit for three. At that time it was a terrible experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location - Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: sor046
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the museum quarter which is a very good starting point to explore Amsterdam. However the room we had was tiny and not very tidy. The recepionist changed almost every day and the service personal were not very helpful nor very friendly. The booking system was chaotic. In my room the TV was broken and even after mentioning this to the service personal they did not fix it. Breakfast was served from 8am which is useless for business travelers and even after mentioning it the day before that we would need breakfast earlier it depened only on the person in charge of the day whether one actually would get the breakfast at the suggested time eg 7.30 or not. In summary great location, bad service. Rather a motel and not a hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Comedy (Not So) Central”
Reviews.Author: vmpiyo
Reviews.Content: On arrival (after my delayed flight) I was welcomed by the stench of alcohol coming from the man at the reception (who might I also add had his flies undone! - Don't know what he was doing before we arrived!) The room was relatively clean but stuffy, not bad size, however none of the furniture matched - if you care about these things. (Rubbsih iron board). Only one plug, which was behind the TV so a bit difficult to reach. Hangers not matching. No sparkling water, no chilled soft drink. Noisy banging doors. Breakfast was pre chosen with very little choice, scary waitress, if you wanted more fruit you had to pay. Other than that everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: aaengland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was supposed to be a family run concern, if it was they are a very dysfunctional miserable lot and the hotel is not near everything as it states, it is at least 25 minutes walk to the busy part of the city. We were given a room in the basement down a small very steep winding staircase, underneath the 24 hour bar, fortunately the bar was always empty, it was part of the dining area so how it could be called a bar lounge was a joke. Our room had a sky light in the ceiling and the staff (who were surly scruffy and rude) they would set the tables at 5 am in the morning , they would put the light on and the light would shine through the skylight in our celing when I phoned reception and complained THEY COULD NOT UNDERSTAND WHAT I WAS SAYING.. Our break was from Monday 12th April unitl Friday 16th April. Our room was not cleaned until the Thursday, a member of staff asked us for our key on the Thursday (apparently the reason why the room was not cleaned, was because they only had one key), they never asked us to leave the key before this. Breakfast was ok, one tea bag in a large pot that was only half full, they usually forgot to put something on the tray, ie milk, butter eggs, so you had to ask for it and be given dirty looks by the horrible staff.. We were there at the time of the volcanic disruption, and to say they were unhelpful and could not care less was an understatement. We transferred to the NH City Centre hotel which is further into city and this was super. Worse hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Shame because the location is fine....”
Reviews.Author: BCMMan
Reviews.Content: Wierd fort knox style entrance arrangement, just to reception! This hotel inside is the smallest, ugliest and shabbiest hotel I've ever seen. Staff were OK and helpful but really , the room was terrible, flaking paint, damp patch, bed raised about 3 inches from the floor, and walls so thin I could hear the people talking next door. Had to put suitcase (just 1 small trolley style case) on the floor, there was literally no space. TV had 3 chanels on it and no tea or coffee in the room either. A real pity because with the right management and a facelift this could be a gem. In my opinion, don't bother guys.

Reviews.Title: “A below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alekor89
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay in Amsterdam which is a great city but i had a few doughts about the hotel i stayed in.First, the rooms were quite large but not clean enough.The bathroom had no rubbish bin and had at the most of the time a horibble smell of mold.I am not sure if the sheets were changed as long as we were there but our beds were layed badly.There was no refrigerator and the phone was not working.There was no buffet on breakfast even thougn the food was enough for all.The staff though was very helpfull and the hotel's location quite good.Even though it was a little bit far from the center there were buses and trams to drive you there in a sec.I would only reccomend this hotel to anyone who want just a sleep...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a hotel out of town”
Reviews.Author: bazilio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. We stayed for 3 days. It's close to the Vondelpark and the museum district. So, the silence is complete. The breakfast is nice and also the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: BnD80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sander for one night in December. The hotel is conveniently located in the Museumplein district. We had a doubleroom which was clean and spacious (with tall ceilings and a bay window). We were on the third floor - watch out for the steep twisty stairs (but don't worry, there's also a lift for the less adventurous). Breakfast (included in the room rate) is served downstairs in the bar room. Probably the worst thing about Hotel Sander in our experience was the paper thin walls - you could hear everything going on in the rooms above and next door. For those looking for location and good value the Hotel Sander is not a bad choice - just hope that you have quieter neighbours than we did!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but insufficient”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlAth
Reviews.Content: Preety little hotel in a very quiet neighbourhood out of the centre of Amsterdam. Friendly stuff, but terrible breakfast and so small room! They changed every day our towels but never the sheets in 1 week!! My guide says it's a gay hotel but i haven't seen gays one week there. If u want a peacefull and relaxing environment and if u don't care so much about the breakfast i could recommend this hotel. But the change of the sheets cannot be neglected!

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time”
Reviews.Author: DDawnC
Reviews.Content: This was our second time visiting Amsterdam, and we chose to stay at the Sander again. The room we got was huge and newly refurbished- very nice. It looks like the one in the picture, with a wall of new windows, nicely tiled bathroom, big closet, faux fireplace, small sitting area, and spare twin bed. The breakfast was identical to last time- perfectly fine and tasty. The neighborhood is wonderfully quiet and a convenient jumping off point for getting to other parts of town. The staff made our stay very nice, too. We got help with bus routes, restaurant addresses, and taxi rides. There doesn't seem to be a bad person working there- they have all been very helpful and nice. On our second day there, we returned to find a small bottle of red wine and two glasses in our room, courtesy of the staff. We love Amsterdam, and we really like the Hotel Sander.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: simpsob
Reviews.Content: We had a recently refurbished family room in this small hotel near to the Museums in Amsterdam. The staff were friendly and the hotel was clean and pleasant. The breakfast was limited in terms of choice but quite sufficient. The tram stop to the centre of the city is just around the corner making it an ideal place to stay. We had read some of the reviews and were a little concerned but would recommend it to anyone and would certainly stay again. Nice little hotel in a residential area so nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sander Don't Go !”
Reviews.Author: ChesterAnnieD
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Amsterdam and stayed at this hotel, a word of advice don't go ! The number of complaints we haveare too many to be counted, it is too far from the city centre,breakfast is appalling and cheaply made, everything is done by penny pinching and it shows, good value for money not at all ! Curtains hanging by sticky tape in the rooms, no tea and coffee making facilities, dreadful. We would NEVER EVER GO BACK Annie from Chester Feb 2007

Reviews.Title: “Terribly dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: LJC1
Reviews.Content: I had read good reviews of this 'hotel', but was terribly dissapointed when I arrived. It turned out to be a run down, none too clean, bed and breakfast establishment. My room was small and dim, with only a tiny light over the door, 2 tiny bedside lights and 1 even smaller desk light. The room was certainly warm, which was just as well as their was a howling gale coming in the window frame. The beds were clean and comfortable, the only really good thing. The shower room was clean enough, with plenty of hot water, but the air vent was disgusting. The furniture was rickity, I went to put my jacket in the cupboard, and took it out again as the cupboard was smelly. The breakfast is continental, and barely adequate. Why I say it is a bed and breakfast place is there is a bar, but the bar/lounge area and tiny reception area are closed and locked from 14.00p.m. in the afternoon, till 7a.m. the next morning, there are no staff in the hotel at all from this time, so what ever you do don't forget your room card, as it also unlocks the outside door, just make sure it works o.k. The hotel is certainly in a nice residential area, only 10-15 mins from the museums, and a further 5mins or so from the entertainment centre. This place is only sutiable for a very short stay, and not for the discerning traveller.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in early november. The hotel is clean and quiet, and certainly family friendly, tolerating the little upsets and alarms of family life, like when we dropped a bottle of juice three stories, onto the conservatory roof... We had the family room, which was large and very nice. The hotel is close to the Concertgebouw and Rijksmuseum, and we enjoyed walking into the centre of the town each morning. Certainly recommended if you want to avoid the noise of other people having fun in the middle of the night in the middle of the town

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but friendly”
Reviews.Author: awells
Reviews.Content: A small hotel for which a short tram ride (no.16) is required from city centre. This means it is a little cheaper than othrs. It is close to Concertgebouw and Vondelpark in fairly quiet residential street.The rooms are generally small, particularly for single occupancy, however they are clean if uninspiring. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served in room overlooking small courtyard garden. There is a small bar. Recommended if you require no frills accommodation cheaper thn cty centre.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sander
HotelInfo.Address: Jacob Obrechtstraat 69, Amsterdam 1071 KJ, The Netherlands
